item.title: adafruit
item.description: Giving Tuesday ‚Äì KiCad open-source design #GivingTuesday üíªüîßüåç‚ù§Ô∏èü§ùKiCad is an open-source software suite for electronic design automation (EDA), enabling users to design schematics and printed circuit boards (PCBs). KiCad is a great, free, open tool for creating complex designs, from hobbyist projects to professional-grade hardware. As an open-source initiative, KiCad promotes accessibility and collaboration, making advanced EDA tools freely available.

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Will it transpire that the South Korean Parliament have more guts than the US Congress?

item.title: Jason Lefkowitz
item.description: As an American, I keep having to remind myself that in most countries trying to overthrow the government has consequences

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: Scientists have found that a toddler who lived in Montana 12,800 years ago had a diet made up in large part of mammoth. The finding may offer a clue to how mammoths and other large North American mammals became extinct. Here's my story [gift link]: https://nyti.ms/4gjYsvf

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Organizing space through saccades and fixations between primate posterior parietal cortex and hippocampus
https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-024-54736-7
#neuroscience

item.title: European Commission
item.description:
Today, we ordered TikTok to freeze and preserve all data and evidence linked to the Romanian elections.

This follows recent declassified information pointing to foreign interference from Russia.

We are also intensifying contacts with digital and cyber regulators across Europe in light of emerging evidence of systematic inauthentic activity.
A key step to enforce the Digital Services Act.

More: https://europa.eu/!fN4Xt6

#EU #DSA

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: 92NY posted the video of my recent on-stage conversation with Donald Johanson about the 50th anniversary of Lucy. I hope you enjoy it. https://youtu.be/1sit8X9mHeY?si=6yAgb9IkDEvWDN5G

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: More video! Here's my conversation with Nobel-prize winner Katalin Kariko, who pioneered mRNA vaccines. https://youtu.be/5_9ccDmX3hs?si=QrTiRBzTLuQ8hLRz

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: One more video! Here's my recent talk at Florida Atlantic University about what artificial intelligence can (and cannot) tell us about what it means to be alive. https://youtu.be/0APuNgLI06M?si=W2UgyW8fYgzdOGBQ

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
My ultimate systems paper would include electric fields and their influence. They provide a lot of useful dimensionality reduction. Brain function extends beyond spikes.
Imagining the ultimate systems neuroscience paper
https://www.thetransmitter.org/systems-neuroscience/imagining-the-ultimate-systems-neuroscience-paper/
#neuroscience

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: Early next year, I'll be talking about my new book, AIR-BORNE. On publication day, February 25, I'll be in New York for an on-stage conversation with Jad Abumrad, creator of Radiolab, at 92NY. Join us, good people of New York! Details here https://www.92ny.org/event/the-life-we-breathe 1/4

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: I‚Äôll also be talking in Boston, New Haven, St. Louis, and other places. I‚Äôm keeping a running list of events on my website: https://carlzimmer.com/talks/ 2/4

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: In my latest email newsletter, I explain how working with Jad on a Radiolab episode at the start of the pandemic helped hurl me into the remarkable world of aerobiology, which led to my writing a book about the experience. https://buttondown.com/carlzimmer/archive/fridays-elk-the-air-borne-tour-takes-shape/ 3/4

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: This is all three months away...but you can pre-order the book now. Thanks for your support! https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/724793/air-borne-by-carl-zimmer/ 4/4
